NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Requires the grants to be used for: NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR professional development for IHE faculty and staff, including the search for and review of open textbooks; NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR the creation or adaptation of open educational resources, especially open textbooks; NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR the development or improvement of tools and informational resources that support the use of open textbooks; NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR research evaluating the efficacy of using open textbooks to achieve savings for students; and NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR partnerships with other entities to carry out the preceding activities. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Requires the full and complete digital content of the educational resources created or adopted using such grant funds to be made available free of charge to the public: (1) on an easily accessible and interoperable website; and (2) in a machine readable, digital format that anyone can directly download, edit, and redistribute. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Directs the Secretary to give special consideration to grant applicants that demonstrate the greatest potential to: NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR achieve the highest level of savings for students; NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR expand the use of open textbooks at other IHEs; and NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR produce open textbooks that are of the highest quality, that can be most easily utilized and adapted by faculty members, that correspond to the highest enrollment courses, and that are created or adopted in partnership with entities that will assist in their marketing and distribution.
